column3: Code Review ACK db146ecd7fabff3457102c9a6ef35d2bd1b7c3b0\nWould like it if we took the opportunity to make the syntax highlighting hints more uniform but no worries. (I'm guessing "shell" means POSIX-compliant shell?)

Given the syntax highlighting was pointed out twice, I've pushed to fix that up. I settled on using `bash` because that resulted in more highlighting in the editor I was looking at.  On GitHub using `bash` vs `shell` doesn't seem to make a difference.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18340/commits/84a46a9b93671b899faf3900936904199d92daaf\n\nThese changes to the FreeBSD installation instructions broke travis Linux badly: [heap-use-after-free (pid=27489)](https://travis-ci.org/github/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/663739815#L4596)!

nit: since you replaced `bash` with `shell` in `build-netbsd.md`, if you would be updating the patch, maybe `s/bash/shell/` also here in `build-openbsd.md`. But the patch is good to go as is IMO since its purpose is to deal with `MAKE=gmake` issue.
